title: The Papers: 'No tax cuts in 2023' and TikTok facing US ban
description: Friday's front pages mostly lead on households facing more bills amid interest rates rising.

title: England fans charged at by police and struck with batons before win over Italy in Naples
description: England fans tell the BBC that they were charged at by police and struck with batons when they tried to get into Napoli's Diego Armando Maradona Stadium on Thursday.

title: Top Gear filming halted after Freddie Flintoff accident
description: The BBC said it would be "inappropriate" to resume making the popular TV show's new series for now.

title: Bordeaux town hall set on fire in France pension protests
description: Fire engulfs the building's front as violence flares in several cities during pension reform protests.

title: World Match Play Championship: World number two Jon Rahm wins to keep hopes alive
description: World number two Jon Rahm beats Keith Mitchell to keep alive his hopes of winning the WGC-Dell Technologies Match Play Championship in Austin, Texas.

title: Harry Kane: How the striker broke the England goals record
description: Harry Kane fires himself into the record books, scoring his 54th international goal to surpass Wayne Rooney as England's all-time leading goalscorer. Here is how.

title: San Marino 0-2 Northern Ireland: Dion Charles scores twice as NI win on Michael O'Neill's return
description: Michael O'Neill's second spell as Northern Ireland manager gets off to a winning start as a Dion Charles double gives his side a comfortable 2-0 away victory over San Marino.

title: Harry Kane breaks Wayne Rooney's all-time England goalscoring record
description: Harry Kane becomes England's all-time top goalscorer with his 54th goal for the Three Lions in their opening Euro 2024 qualifier against Italy.

title: Portugal v Liechtenstein: Cristiano Ronaldo becomes most capped men's international player
description: Cristiano Ronaldo makes a world-record 197th men's international appearance in Portugal's Euro 2024 qualifying opener in Lisbon.

title: TikTok ban: What could it mean for creators?
description: People have built careers off the video app. But what will they do if threats to ban it become reality?

title: The Hundred: Shaheen Afridi joins Welsh Fire as Kate Cross moves to Northern Superchargers
description: Pakistan bowler Shaheen Afridi is picked by Welsh Fire and England bowler Kate Cross moves to Northern Superchargers in The Hundred draft.

title: Georgi wins in Belgium two years after breaking back in same race
description: Pfeiffer Georgi claims a solo win at the Classic Brugge-De Panne two and a half years after breaking her back in the same race.

title: World Athletics bans transgender female athletes from competing in female world ranking events
description: World Athletics has banned transgender female athletes from competing in the female category at international events.

title: Russia: Doping suspension lifted but ban on nation's athletes remains because of Ukraine war
description: Russia's doping suspension is lifted but the nation will remain banned "for the foreseeable future" because of the war in Ukraine, the World Athletics Council rules.

title: 'Yes or no?' US politicians grill TikTok boss
description: Watch the moments when things got testy during a Congressional hearing on the app's practices.

title: Tyson Fury v Oleksandr Usyk: 'A 14st coward'- Fury in foul-mouthed rant at Usyk
description: Tyson Fury has called fellow heavyweight champion Oleksandr Usyk a "14-stone coward" in an expletive-laden social media post after talks for an undisputed fight broke down.

title: Masked man with loaded gun stopped from entering Florida strip club
description: Security guards fight off the man in Tampa, Florida, possibly preventing a mass shooting, police say.

title: Seoul zebra escape: Animal back at zoo after hours on the loose
description: The young animal is unharmed after trotting around some residential streets.

title: Woman 'worried' after police officer followed her on Instagram
description: She told a police misconduct hearing she saw PC Jack Harrison by chance at a supermarket.

title: John Wick: Chapter 4 - Keanu Reeves film lands franchise's best reviews

title: Israeli PM to visit UK amid growing turmoil at home

title: Gwyneth Paltrow crash: Skier 'affected on many levels by brain injury'

title: Ukraine takes on UK in solidarity chess tournament

title: Commercial development of gene-edited food now legal in England

description: Thomas Cashman, 34, who is accused of shooting Olivia Pratt-Korbel, denies being the gunman.

title: Manchester United: Finnish entrepreneur Thomas Zilliacus says he has made bid for club

description: The unprecedented surge in numbers is largely due to immigration, the government says.

title: Ikea told to tackle sexual harassment after UK complaint
description: The firm signed an agreement to protect staff in the UK after concerns over how it handled an allegation.
